{"step_by_step_thinking": "Body fluids can be divided into two major compartments: intracellular, which is the fluid within cells, and extracellular, which is the fluid outside of cells. The extracellular fluid can be further divided into interstitial fluid, which is the fluid between cells, and blood plasma, which is the fluid component of blood. Peritoneal fluid is a specific type of fluid found in the abdominal cavity, not a general compartment of body fluid.", "answer_choice": "A"}
